IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of trees near our overhead cables. This has identified trees that have grown close, which could damage the cables and affect your electricity supply. Our engineers need to temporarily switch off your power so we can safely cut the trees away from 4 sections of cables. This work is taking place during the school holidays as part of the area where we are working is used for lessons during term time. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate some customers may have experienced unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. This work is taking place near Studham Lane.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Stuart at 20:24 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers diverted power around an underground network fault in the Rochester ME1 1, ME2 1 area. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hello, Stuart from the messaging team here. Thanks for your patience today, our field staff and control room engineers have worked to get your power back on as quickly as they can.

Our records show that some properties affected by today's power cut may have had other unexpected interruptions recently. If you have, we're sorry for further disruption. All power cuts are fully investigated by our engineers but can sometimes happen multiple times before we can safely find the issue and fix it.

We know that not everyone affected by today's power cut will have had other power cuts recently, but we want you to know that if you have, our customer services team will try to update as many customers as possible about our investigations.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Stuart at 20:05 - Our engineers are on their way. We believe the issue is an underground cable fault that initially interrupted power to 512 properties. However, we have managed to divert power back to some properties, so 393 properties are still affected. Specialist engineers from our control room will continue to divert power remotely, so your power may come back on at any point. Sometimes we can't restore everyone this way, so we're also sending staff to check our equipment. We're currently estimating power will be on between 23:00, but this may change depending on what our staff find. Power back on? To stop receiving texts, follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Otherwise, we'll keep you updated.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lee at 15:02 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers diverted the power and connected up generators to the network in the Amage Road area. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected overhead cable fault has caused.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers are still on site connecting up the generators.

Although these will be temporary, engineers will still need to repair the issue before they can be removed and network power is resumed. Depending on the fault, it may take several days for our engineers to pinpoint the problem and plan in the work. The temporary generators will remain on site to provide power until we can locate the issue and restore the network back to normal running conditions.

If you'd like any further information, our team are always here to help. Sent by Lee at 14:34.

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 10:44 - Hi David here again. I'm sorry for how long you were without power for. We can now confirm that all power in the area should be back on. Our engineers had to unexpectedly turn off the power to safely repair a faulty piece of underground electrical equipment in the Brian Crescent area.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by David at 10:22 - Hi David here again. I'm sorry that power is still off this morning. Just to let you know. Our engineers are still on site in the Brian Crescent area working on digging down to the faulty underground electrical equipment so they can work on repairs and restore your power. At the moment we don't need to change the estimated timeframe. We're sorry for the disruption this power cut may be causing. If you're worried about elderly or ill neighbours, we can offer help and support to our vulnerable customers during a power cut. Find out more here: https://bit.ly/40quttu. If you have any concerns, please call us on 08003163105
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Thanks for your patience today. We know a power cut can be difficult, especially in colder weather.

Many properties have gas hobs, which can still be used in a power cut for cooking, or heating water for drinks and sterilisation of baby bottles. The spark to ignite the hob will not work however, so if you do use it please take extra care when using other ignition sources like matches or lighters. Even in daytime, the light in your house may be low in a power cut, so only do this if you are confident it can be done safely.

If you have any questions or concerns, our team are always on hand to help.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

As our staff are working with live electricity, we need to wait until it is safe for them to stop and contact us with an update.

We're sorry you've been impacted by this, and we'll provide you an update as soon as possible. Sent by Lisa at 22:24.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi, this is Lisa - I wanted to let you know I have just taken over for the night shift, so I'll be here until tomorrow morning making sure you have the latest news from our staff.

I know that power being off may be especially worrying for you as we head later into the evening, but our field teams work 24 hours so I'll let know further news as soon as it comes in.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Simon at 21:46 - As it's approaching that time of night where most of our customers are going to sleep, we wanted to let you know that we will continue to send text messages throughout the night with progress updates. If you want to continue receiving updates but prefer not to be disturbed, you can place your phone on silent or activate the Do Not Disturb settings on smart phones. If you no longer want to receive updates, you will need to visit our website here - https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Thank you
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Winter is here and temperatures are low, so we understand that it can be very concerning to have a power cut as this may have affected your heating.

Should you have a gas hob, you may be able to carefully ignite it with matches or a lighter in order for you to warm up with a hot drink or meal. Please only attempt this if you are confident it can be done safely.

If you have someone in the property who may be more vulnerable to the cold please do not hesitate to call us free on 105.

We will do our best to provide additional care and support whilst work continues to get your power back on ASAP.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of a power cut at 21:35. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly.

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 09:29 - Hi David here again. We have now restored power to the St Clements Close area.

We are truly sorry for the power cuts recently. We believe there may be an underlying issue causing this, but it is proving difficult for our engineers to locate and therefore fix. To get your power back on today we have reconfigured the local electricity network. This in turn will both help pinpoint the issue and minimise further interruptions.

If you'd like more information on the issue, or if your power isn't back on, call us on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
I appreciate your continued patience this morning. I know having power cuts as often as this must be very disruptive, and our staff are doing everything they can to get this resolved.

They are still testing our network in the area, and depending on the local infrastructure this can take some time. However, once they update us we'll know if our estimated time frame needs to change and why, and I'll let you know as soon as we hear.

In the meantime, if we can offer any support or advice, our team are always available to talk on 105.

Sent by Aaron at 10:03 - We're very sorry we've had to switch off your electricity.

Our engineers have turned off the power in the Chevening Road area for safety so they can repair an underground network fault. Our estimated time to have your power back on is between 13:00-14:00 and , however, this may need to change later depending on how our works progress.

Sent by David at 09:29 - Hi David here again. We have now restored power to the St Clements Close area.

We are truly sorry for the power cuts recently. We believe there may be an underlying issue causing this, but it is proving difficult for our engineers to locate and therefore fix. To get your power back on today we have reconfigured the local electricity network. This in turn will both help pinpoint the issue and minimise further interruptions.

If you'd like more information on the issue, or if your power isn't back on, call us on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

I appreciate your continued patience this morning. I know having power cuts as often as this must be very disruptive, and our staff are doing everything they can to get this resolved.

They are still testing our network in the area, and depending on the local infrastructure this can take some time. However, once they update us we'll know if our estimated time frame needs to change and why, and I'll let you know as soon as we hear.

In the meantime, if we can offer any support or advice, our team are always available to talk on 105.

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

Our staff have found a potentially dangerous situation involving a tree that has fallen onto our overhead electrical cables so have responded as quickly as possible and asked our control room to turn power off to the area using our high voltage network. This is why a wide area has lost electricity.

Our field teams are working to fix the issue as quickly as possible, and we'll start diverting power back to affected homes as soon as they advise us it's safe. You may notice your lights going on and off as we work to get as much power restored as we can.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Salisbury Hall Gardens area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Sent by Aaron at 11:59.

We believe the power cuts you have been experiencing are caused by a fault with one of the cables. Developing faults can start very small, and so can be hard to detect but each power cut usually makes it easier to see, which means our specialist staff can detect it, and work on the repair to prevent further outages.

I'll let you know once our teams arrive.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

Our staff have now arrived on site in the Salisbury Hall Gardens area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Sent by Aaron at 11:59.

Sent by Adam at 11:17 - Our staff are on the way to the Salisbury Hall Gardens area, and our estimated time frame to have power back on is currently between 14:00 and 15:00. However, this could change once our staff have assessed the local network.

We believe the power cuts you have been experiencing are caused by a fault with one of the cables. Developing faults can start very small, and so can be hard to detect but each power cut usually makes it easier to see, which means our specialist staff can detect it, and work on the repair to prevent further outages.

I'll let you know once our teams arrive.

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 11:45 - Our control room has been able to restore power to all 1265 properties in the RH7 6 area, and we're pleased that this is sooner than we estimated. They have restored power remotely around the faulty overhead electrical equipment

We know some properties in the area may have faced other recent interruptions, and we're sorry for the extra disruption. Every outage is fully investigated by our engineers, though power may be lost several times before we can safely find and fix the issue. Our customer services team will keep as many customers updated as possible during these investigations. 

We're sorry for the unplanned disruption. If you need to talk to us, or let us know that your power isn't restored, call us on 08003163105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by David at 11:16 - Our engineers are on their way. We believe the issue is faulty overhead electrical equipment that initially interrupted power to 1265 properties. However, we have managed to divert power back to some properties, so 81 properties are still affected. Specialist engineers from our control room will continue to divert power remotely, so your power may come back on at any point. Sometimes we can't restore everyone this way, so we're also sending staff to check our equipment. We're currently estimating power will be on between 14:00-15:00, but this may change depending on what our staff find. Power back on? To stop receiving texts, follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Otherwise, we'll keep you updated.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage affects multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you expect. We're arranging staff to attend ASAP, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting electricity. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to get as many customers back on as we can.

Once available, our engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, they will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will work to locate the issue and make repairs, which may take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing but we'll always give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Sent by Bev at 14:58 - We're very sorry we've had to switch off your electricity. Our engineers have turned off the power in the Calcott Hill area in the interest of public safety. This is so they can make urgent repairs to a damaged pole and low hanging overhead cables, following a road traffic collision.

If in the area, please take care and stay at least 10m away from the cable. 

Until our engineers arrive on site and investigate, it's difficult to advise you a time frame. However, based on an average for this kind of issue, our estimated time to have you back on is between 19:30 and 20:30. 

We'll keep you updated with our progress, but in the meantime our team are always here to talk on 105 if you have any questions or concerns.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Bev at 21:46 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 108 customers in the GU8 4 area, by repairing the low hanging overhead cable. We know your power may have been off for a long time, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Bev at 21:19 - Hi - thanks for bearing with us, I know a power cut can be very disruptive. We've had an update from our staff that there are now 5 properties still affected by the the low hanging overhead cable, as they have managed to safely divert some power, getting the lights back on for 103 of our customers. We'll keep sending text updates to everyone until all the power to your area is on. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Hi, Bev here from the text messaging team. I wanted to apologise that you are still without power. Each job is different, but we provide our estimated times based on similar jobs we have completed in your area. The times given are always subject to how each fault develops. For this reason, please rest assured that I'll be regularly looking for updates and will continue to send you messages with the most up to date information.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 15:35 - I'm texting to say I am glad to report that power to the The Broadway area should now be back on.

Following thorough tests at our substation and on local network equipment, our staff have been able to safely replace our network equipment. The suspected underground cabling issue is not yet appearing on any of our tests, so for the moment we have restored your power as quickly as possible.

I'm afraid this may happen again, but every time you lose power it gives us a better chance of pinpointing the problem. I'm sorry for the continued disruption, but If you'd like to talk to us about this, or if your power isn't on call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
I appreciate your continued patience this afternoon. We want to be as transparent as possible as we know having multiple power cuts is disruptive and worrying, so I would like to help explain why we can't always fix a problem like this right away.

Underground electricity cabling is insulated for safety and if a fault develops, these materials can re-seal due to heat passing through them when our safety equipment operates and your power is lost. This covers any potential fault again, meaning our staff cannot locate it using their tests or specialist equipment.

We'll know more once our staff contact us again, so I'll be in touch again shortly.

Sent by Simon at 15:32.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the The Broadway area. Due to there being multiple power cuts over a short space of time, our engineers are going to be testing if the network is still healthy.

They will start at the substation, and often apply specialist equipment that may turn your power back on for a brief period, so don't worry if your power comes on and goes off again. They will also check smaller sites which run along our cabling route, these break our network down into smaller sections and can help pinpoint any possible problems.

Our estimated time frame of 18:00-19:00 hasn't changed, so I'll let you know more once our staff update us. Sent by Simon at 14:55.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 16:05 - We can now confirm that all power in the Wellfields area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault with some of our network equipment, which our engineers have now replaced.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 15:42 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Our engineers have arrived on site in the Wellfields area, the estimated time of 19:00 and 20:00 hasn't changed. We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress, but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Logs.Comment:
Sent by Simon at 16:37 - We can now confirm that all power in the Manor Avenue area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault with some of our network equipment, which our engineers have now replaced.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

Our engineers have arrived on site in the Manor Avenue area, the estimated time of 19:00-20:00 hasn't changed.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can.

We'll update you with all of our progress, but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. If you would like more information about what we think the fault is; here's a short YouTube video https://bit.ly/2y8Dtfz. Sent by Simon at 16:06.

Sent by Simon at 15:53 - Engineers are on their way. At this point we think the issue is a fault with equipment in your local substation in the Manor Avenue area. We didn't know this was going to happen, so time frames we provide throughout are estimated and are subject to change.

Our estimated time to have power back on is currently between 19:00 and 20:00, but after we arrive and assess the situation this may change. The reason for this is there can sometimes be a more complex underlying issue found by our engineer's tests which may take longer, and if not we may get power back on sooner.

All of our texts are written and sent personally by our team, and we'll let you know once our staff arrive.

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Wendover Road HP22 area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: A fault occurred on a piece of our electrical equipment which controls the power to your home.
PlannedIncidentReason: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
MainMessage: We have repaired the problem with the electricity supply in your area. There may still be some tidying up to do, and any details have been passed to our Maintenance department, who will attend to it as soon as possible. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 22:07. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We've had to turn off power in your area so our engineers can safely carry out emergency repairs to the network.
PlannedIncidentReason: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
MainMessage: We are aware of an incident caused by Emergency Isolation affecting the electricity supply in your area. Our engineers are dealing with this and we estimate that most supplies will be restored by 23-DEC-2025 00:00.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message:
Hi, this is Lisa - I wanted to let you know I have just taken over for the night shift, so I'll be here until tomorrow morning making sure you have the latest news from our staff.

I know that power being off may be especially worrying for you as we head later into the evening, but our field teams work 24 hours so I'll let know further news as soon as it comes in.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Bev at 21:56 - Engineers are on their way. At this point we think the issue is a fault with equipment in your local substation in the Julians Way area. We didn't know this was going to happen, so time frames we provide throughout are estimated and are subject to change.

Our estimated time to have power back on is currently between 02:30 and 03:30, but after we arrive and assess the situation this may change. The reason for this is there can sometimes be a more complex underlying issue found by our engineer's tests which may take longer, and if not we may get power back on sooner.

All of our texts are written and sent personally by our team, and we'll let you know once our staff arrive.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 21:23 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to several thousand customers, by diverting power around an underground network fault. This means we have been able to restore power sooner than we anticipated, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
